subject: Re: [junit] how to ensure only one test runs at a time?
msgSnippet: It would still be a considerably larger effort than doing nothing, right? ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
It would still be a considerably larger effort than doing nothing, right?
:)

On 9/8/06, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
>
> On 9/8/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...<joakim.ohlrogge%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> >
> > > Unless I'm having a really brain dead Friday afternoon, this is the
> > > default behaviour of JUnit. All tests are run sequentially (order is
> > > undefined) and each test will complete (or fail) before the next one
> > > is started.
> >
> > If that is not correct then there are two of us having brain dead
> > afternoons :)
> > It would take a considerably larger effort to make the tests run
> > concurrently.
>
> I don't see why, it's fairly trivial to do with java.util.concurrent and
> it
> can result in spectacular speed improvements (a TestNG user reported a 10x
> increase in test running
> times<
> http://groups.google.com/group/testng-users/browse_frm/thread/dff9feb2d28a59d0/d7861440ade6a01b?lnk=gst&q=parallel+speed+up&rnum=1#d7861440ade6a01b
> >when
> they turned the "parallel" flag on...).
>
> --
> Cédric
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
